author: dchristian3188
body:
Outvariable does not seem to work correctly when creating a object from a PowerShell class

Steps to reproduce
------------------
```powershell
Class TestClass
{
    [string]$SomeProperty
}

New-Object -TypeName TestClass -OutVariable a
$a.SomeProperty = "Test"
```
Expected behavior
-----------------
The property on the variable is updated to the value of "Test"

Actual behavior
---------------
```powershell
The property 'SomeProperty' cannot be found on this object. Verify that the property exists and can be set.
At line:3 char:1
+ $a.SomeProperty = "Test"
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : PropertyAssignmentException
 ```


Environment data
----------------
```powershell
PS C:\> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
CLRVersion
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.18-21-ge8a0f3ca639d2a94d672e2120f65516259075dd4
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSEdition                      Core
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: You can see the class in array `$a[0].SomeProperty`.
